target: And the captain of the guard charged Joseph with them, and he served them: and they continued a season in ward.
reference: And the captain of the guard charged Joseph with them, and he served them: and they continued a season in ward.

target: ¶ And they dreamed a dream both of them, each man his dream in one night, each man according to the interpretation of his dream, the butler and the baker of the king of Egypt, which were bound in the prison.
reference: ¶ And they dreamed a dream both of them, each man his dream in one night, each man according to the interpretation of his dream, the butler and the baker of the king of Egypt, which were bound in the prison.

target: And Joseph came in unto them in the morning, and looked upon them, and, behold, they were sad.
reference: And Joseph came in unto them in the morning, and looked upon them, and, behold, they were sad.

target: And he asked Pharaoh’s officers that were with him in the ward of his lord’s house, saying, Wherefore look ye so sadly to day?
reference: And he asked Pharaoh’s officers that were with him in the ward of his lord’s house, saying, Wherefore look ye so sadly to day?

target: And they said unto him, We have dreamed a dream, and there is no interpreter of it. And Joseph said unto them, Do not interpretations belong to God? tell me them, I pray you.
reference: And they said unto him, We have dreamed a dream, and there is no interpreter of it. And Joseph said unto them, Do not interpretations belong to God? tell me them, I pray you.

target: And the chief butler told his dream to Joseph, and said to him, In my dream, behold, a vine was before me;
reference: And the chief butler told his dream to Joseph, and said to him, In my dream, behold, a vine was before me;

target: And in the vine were three branches: and it was as though it budded, and her blossoms shot forth; and the clusters thereof brought forth ripe grapes:
reference: And in the vine were three branches: and it was as though it budded, and her blossoms shot forth; and the clusters thereof brought forth ripe grapes:

target: And Pharaoh’s cup was in my hand: and I took the grapes, and pressed them into Pharaoh’s cup, and I gave the cup into Pharaoh’s hand.
reference: And Pharaoh’s cup was in my hand: and I took the grapes, and pressed them into Pharaoh’s cup, and I gave the cup into Pharaoh’s hand.

target: And Joseph said unto him, This is the interpretation of it: The three branches are three days:
reference: And Joseph said unto him, This is the interpretation of it: The three branches are three days:

target: Yet within three days shall Pharaoh lift up thine head, and restore thee unto thy place: and thou shalt deliver Pharaoh’s cup into his hand, after the former manner when thou wast his butler.
reference: Yet within three days shall Pharaoh lift up thine head, and restore thee unto thy place: and thou shalt deliver Pharaoh’s cup into his hand, after the former manner when thou wast his butler.

target: But think on me when it shall be well with thee, and shew kindness, I pray thee, unto me, and make mention of me unto Pharaoh, and bring me out of this house:
reference: But think on me when it shall be well with thee, and shew kindness, I pray thee, unto me, and make mention of me unto Pharaoh, and bring me out of this house:

target: For indeed I was stolen away out of the land of the Hebrews: and here also have I done nothing that they should put me into the dungeon.
reference: For indeed I was stolen away out of the land of the Hebrews: and here also have I done nothing that they should put me into the dungeon.

target: When the chief baker saw that the interpretation was good, he said unto Joseph, I also was in my dream, and, behold, I had three white baskets on my head:
reference: When the chief baker saw that the interpretation was good, he said unto Joseph, I also was in my dream, and, behold, I had three white baskets on my head:

target: And in the uppermost basket there was of all manner of bakemeats for Pharaoh; and the birds did eat them out of the basket upon my head.
reference: And in the uppermost basket there was of all manner of bakemeats for Pharaoh; and the birds did eat them out of the basket upon my head.

target: And Joseph answered and said, This is the interpretation thereof: The three baskets are three days:
reference: And Joseph answered and said, This is the interpretation thereof: The three baskets are three days:

target: Yet within three days shall Pharaoh lift up thy head from off thee, and shall hang thee on a tree; and the birds shall eat thy flesh from off thee.
reference: Yet within three days shall Pharaoh lift up thy head from off thee, and shall hang thee on a tree; and the birds shall eat thy flesh from off thee.

target: ¶ And it came to pass the third day, which was Pharaoh’s birthday, that he made a feast unto all his servants: and he lifted up the head of the chief butler and of the chief baker among his servants.
reference: ¶ And it came to pass the third day, which was Pharaoh’s birthday, that he made a feast unto all his servants: and he lifted up the head of the chief butler and of the chief baker among his servants.

target: And he restored the chief butler unto his butlership again; and he gave the cup into Pharaoh’s hand:
reference: And he restored the chief butler unto his butlership again; and he gave the cup into Pharaoh’s hand:

target: But he hanged the chief baker: as Joseph had interpreted to them.
reference: But he hanged the chief baker: as Joseph had interpreted to them.

target: Yet did not the chief butler remember Joseph, but forgat him.
reference: Yet did not the chief butler remember Joseph, but forgat him.

target: And it came to pass at the end of two full years, that Pharaoh dreamed: and, behold, he stood by the river.
reference: And it came to pass at the end of two full years, that Pharaoh dreamed: and, behold, he stood by the river.

target: And, behold, there came up out of the river seven well favoured kine and fatfleshed; and they fed in a meadow.
reference: And, behold, there came up out of the river seven well favoured kine and fatfleshed; and they fed in a meadow.

target: And, behold, seven other kine came up after them out of the river, ill favoured and leanfleshed; and stood by the other kine upon the brink of the river.
reference: And, behold, seven other kine came up after them out of the river, ill favoured and leanfleshed; and stood by the other kine upon the brink of the river.

target: And the ill favoured and leanfleshed kine did eat up the seven well favoured and fat kine. So Pharaoh awoke.
reference: And the ill favoured and leanfleshed kine did eat up the seven well favoured and fat kine. So Pharaoh awoke.

target: And he slept and dreamed the second time: and, behold, seven ears of corn came up upon one stalk, rank and good.
reference: And he slept and dreamed the second time: and, behold, seven ears of corn came up upon one stalk, rank and good.

target: And, behold, seven thin ears and blasted with the east wind sprung up after them.
reference: And, behold, seven thin ears and blasted with the east wind sprung up after them.

target: And the seven thin ears devoured the seven rank and full ears. And Pharaoh awoke, and, behold, it was a dream.
reference: And the seven thin ears devoured the seven rank and full ears. And Pharaoh awoke, and, behold, it was a dream.

target: And it came to pass in the morning that his spirit was troubled; and he sent and called for all the magicians of Egypt, and all the wise men thereof: and Pharaoh told them his dream; but there was none that could interpret them unto Pharaoh.
reference: And it came to pass in the morning that his spirit was troubled; and he sent and called for all the magicians of Egypt, and all the wise men thereof: and Pharaoh told them his dream; but there was none that could interpret them unto Pharaoh.
